'''Larry Rubin''' (born August 31, 1974) is an American-Mexican businessman and political activist who has lived in both Mexico and the United States. He is currently the Managing Partner Latin America of [http://www.dhrinternational.com/ DHR International], a global American [[executive search]] firm. He is also the President and Chairman of the Board of [[The American Society of Mexico|The American Society]], represents the United States [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]], and writes as a columnist for ''[[Reforma]]'', [[Expansión (Mexico)|CNN ''Expansión'']] and ''[[Forbes]]''.
==Early life and education== Born Larry David Rubin, he completed his [[secondary school|studies through high school]] at the [[ASF Mexico|American School]] before obtaining a degree in business administration at [[Universidad Anahuac Mexico|Anahuac University]].<ref name=":0" /> He has three doctorates "Honoris Causa". He lived in [[El Paso, Texas]], [[Cleveland|Cleveland, Ohio]] and [[Mexico City]].
While attending secondary school, Larry worked as a sales distributor for [[Amway|Amway Corporation]], and had a network of 1,000 distributors as a teenager.<ref name=":4" />
==Business career== At age 19 he worked for [[US Airways]], now [[American Airlines]], as an [[airport check-in]] and baggage agent, and was promoted through several jobs, eventually becoming the Country Manager for Mexico, during which time the airline's national occupancy rose from 900 to 33,000 seats.<ref name=":4" /> He was responsible for the U.S. airline's opening of new routes to [[Cancún]], [[Cozumel]] and [[Mexico City]].<ref name=":4" /> In these destinations, he worked with local businesses and government to provide funding in order to promote passenger travel to the U.S. and Canada.<ref name=":4" /> He also established regular working meetings between U.S. [[airline]]s and the U.S. government in Mexico.<ref name=":4" />
During this time, he was also elected as the first Vice President of the [http://canaero.org.mx/ National Chamber of Air Transport] (representing all U.S. airlines) and on the Board of Directors of [https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confederación_de_Cámaras_Industriales CONCAMIN] (the industrial chambers confederation) where he worked with government to lower costs for U.S. and foreign carriers and improve the working conditions of airline employees.<ref name=":4" /> Thereafter, Rubin became the General Director of Arizona-based direct sales company [[Forever Living Products]] in Mexico and afterwards as Partner for Chicago-based executive search firm [[Spencer Stuart]].<ref name=":5">{{Cite web|url=http://mundoejecutivo.com.mx/econom-negocios/2017/02/16/larry-rubin-apasionado-relaci-n-m-xico-eu|title=Larry Rubín, apasionado de la relación México-EU|last=|first=|date=16 July 2017|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=}}</ref> Rubin is presently the Managing Partner Latin America for Chicago-based [http://www.dhrinternational.com DHR International].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.efinancialcareers.com/us-en/232881/job-in-the-caribbean-mexico-central-america-or-bermuda-away-from-wall-street|title=Leave Wall Street for a job in the Caribbean or Mexico|date=2016-02-01|work=eFinancialCareers|access-date=2017-08-25|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":6">{{Cite web|url=http://www.dhrinternational.com/consultants/about-global-executive-search-consultants/larry-rubin/|title=Larry Rubin {{!}} DHR International|website=www.dhrinternational.com|access-date=2016-11-26}}</ref> He has been in the executive search industry since 2012, placing officers in multinational companies. He has led American companies and organizations since 1996.<ref name=":4">{{Cite news|url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/articulo/nacion/politica/2016/07/15/el-mexicano-estadounidense-que-tomo-vuelo-con-las-aerolineas|title=El mexicano-estadounidense que tomó vuelo con las aerolíneas|last=|first=|date=|accessdate=16 July 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|newspaper=El Universal}}</ref><ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.milenio.com/forosmilenio/energia-renovables-siemens-iniciativa_privada-foros_milenio-asistentes_5_818368166.html|title=Los invitados al foro "El reto del talento en el sector energético"|newspaper=Milenio|access-date=2016-12-07}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/economia/oleada-de-inversiones-foraneas-en-cuba-tardara.html|title=Oleada de inversiones foráneas en Cuba... tardará|website=www.elfinanciero.com.mx|access-date=2016-12-07}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/articulo/nacion/politica/2016/07/15/el-mexicano-estadounidense-que-tomo-vuelo-con-las-aerolineas|title=El mexicano-estadounidense que tomó vuelo con las aerolíneas|newspaper=El Universal|access-date=2017-01-09}}</ref> He gives classes at one of the largest Mexican universities at [[Universidad Anahuac Mexico]], where he promotes U.S. cultural heritage.<ref name=":4" /> Additionally he writes columns for [[CNN International|CNN]], ''[[Forbes]]'' and ''[http://www.reforma.com Reforma]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com.mx/author/larry-rubin/|title=Larry D. === Energy reform === As President of the American Society, Rubin argued for [[energy]] reform in Mexico, saying that oil prices would raise and thousands of jobs were threatened. Working together with a number of energy companies from the U.S. he was able to give specific recommendations to government. Energy reform was thus enacted in Mexico, benefiting many U.S. businesses.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/economia/reforma-energetica-mitigara-impacto-de-petroprecios-larry-rubin.html|title=Reforma energética mitigará impacto de petroprecios: Larry Rubin|website=www.elfinanciero.com.mx|access-date=2017-01-09}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/empresas/mexico-tardara-10-anos-en-formar-talento-para-el-sector-energetico-rubin.html|title=México tardará 10 años en formar talento para el sector energético: Rubin|website=www.elfinanciero.com.mx|access-date=2017-01-09}}</ref>

As of late, Rubin was being vetted for [[Ambassador of the United States to Mexico]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.vdare.com/articles/can-toby-neugebauer-help-trump-face-down-mexico-and-the-u-s-chamber-of-commerce|title=Can Toby Neugebauer Help Trump Face Down Mexico… And The U.S. Chamber of Commerce? {{!}} VDARE - premier news outlet for patriotic immigration reform|website=www.vdare.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-08-25}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://thehill.com/homenews/administration/311696-five-key-ambassador-picks-for-trump|title=Five key ambassador picks for Trump|last=Swanson|first=Ian|date=2016-12-24|work=TheHill|access-date=2017-08-25}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-dines-with-carlos-slim-as-relations-warm-with-mexican-leaders/2016/12/19/652ccf7c-c60f-11e6-bf4b-2c064d32a4bf_story.html|title=Trump meets with Carlos Slim as Mexican leaders seek better relations|last=https://www.facebook.com/PhilipRuckerWP|last2=https://www.facebook.com/costareports|website=Washington Post|access-date=2017-08-25|last3=https://www.facebook.com/josh.partlow1}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.ozy.com/rising-stars/will-he-be-trumps-ambassador-to-mexico/74993|title=If Trump Actually Tries to Build a Wall, This May Be the Guy Keeping the Peace With Mexico|last=Ballew|first=Theo Ellin|work=OZY|access-date=2017-08-25|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.altonivel.com.mx/empresario-larry-rubin-nominado-embajador-eu-en-mexico/|title=Empresario Larry Rubin, nominado como embajador de EU en México|last=|first=|date=18 July 2017|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2017}} '''Lois Dorothy Daish''' {{post-nominals|country=NZL|MNZM}} is a [[New Zealand]] restaurateur, food writer and cookbook author.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bite.co.nz/our-people/518/Lois-Daish/|title=Lois Daish – Food writers, chefs, cooks and foodies in the talented Bite team – Bite|website=www.bite.co.nz|access-date=28 October 2016}}</ref> [[File:Cover of Dinner at Home by Lois Daish.jpg|thumb|''Dinner at Home'' (1993) by Lois Daish]]
== Biography == Daish was born in [[Wellington]], New Zealand and grew up in the suburb of [[Roseneath, Wellington|Roseneath.]] While young, her family moved to New York for two years as her father had a job at the United Nations.<ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/dominion-post/news/local-papers/the-wellingtonian/3119501/The-Wellingtonian-interview-Lois-Daish|title=The Wellingtonian interview: Lois Daish|last=Romanos|first=Joseph|date=3 December 2009|newspaper=Stuff.co.nz|language=English|access-date=29 October 2016}}</ref> This early exposure to American food influenced her interest and taste in food in later years.<ref name=":0" />
In the 1960s, Daish cooked at the [[Downstage Theatre]], and later worked at a bohemian cafe, The Settlement.<ref name=":2" />
In the 1970s, Daish wrote articles for a friend's newspaper in the western suburbs of Wellington; most were on town planning issues, but Daish convinced her friend to include a food column and she wrote food articles for the newspaper as well.<ref name=":2" />
In the 1980s, Daish owned several Wellington restaurants: Number 9 on Bowen St for four years, followed by the Mount Cook Café from 1984 to 1989, and then the Brooklyn Café & Grill.<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":1" /> In 1984 she began writing a food column for the ''[[New Zealand Listener]]'' magazine. For the first ten years she wrote alternate weeks with [[Annabel Langbein]], and from 1994 she wrote the column every week.<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=http://www.pageandblackmore.co.nz/product/62996-NZListenerAGoodYear-9781869416904|title=NZ Listener: A Good Year by Lois Daish {{!}} Page & Blackmore Booksellers|last=CircleSoft|website=Page & Blackmore Booksellers|access-date=29 October 2016}}</ref> She retired from the ''Listener'' in 2009.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.womensweekly.co.nz/latest/celebrity/nici-wickes-an-afternoon-with-my-hero-18782|title=Nici Wickes: An afternoon with my hero|newspaper=New Zealand Women’s Weekly|access-date=29 October 2016}}</ref> In 1987, she was a founding member of the New Zealand Guild of Food Writers.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://wellington.scoop.co.nz/?p=25731|title=Wellington.scoop.co.nz » New Zealand food writers honour Lois Daish|website=wellington.scoop.co.nz|language=en|access-date=28 October 2016}}</ref>
=== Publications === * ''Good Food: Recipes from the Listener'' (1989), {{ISBN|9780908833016}}<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=https://www.eatyourbooks.com/authors/32061/lois-daish|title=Lois Daish Cookbooks, Recipes and Biography {{!}} Eat Your Books|website=www.eatyourbooks.com|access-date=29 October 2016}}</ref> * ''Dinner at Home'' (1993), co-written with Geoffrey Notman, [[Bridget Williams Books]], {{ISBN|9780908912452}}<ref name=":4" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.abebooks.com/book-search/isbn/0908912455/|title=0908912455 – Dinner at Home by Lois Daish and Geoffrey Notman – AbeBooks|website=www.abebooks.com|access-date=29 October 2016}}</ref> * ''Fuss-Free Food for Two'' (1997), {{ISBN|9780908808809}}<ref name=":4" /> * ''A Good Year'' (2005), [[Random House New Zealand]], {{ISBN|9781869416904}}<ref name=":3" />
=== Awards and recognition === In the [[1997 New Year Honours]], Daish was made a [[Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit]]. In 2010, she was elected a life member of the New Zealand Guild of Food Writers.<ref name=":1" />

{{Other people|Michael O'Leary}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Michael O'Leary | image = Michael O’Leary 2015 (cropped).jpg | caption = O’Leary in 2015 at the [[World Economic Forum]] | birth_name = Michael Kevin O'Leary{{cite news|title=People: Ryanair Holdings PLC (RYAAY.O) – O'Leary, Michael|url=https://www.reuters.com/finance/stocks/officerProfile?symbol=RYAAY.O&officerId=174199|publisher=Reuters.com}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1961|03|20|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Kanturk]], [[County Cork]], [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]{{disputed inline|date=July 2017}} | death_date = | residence = [[Delvin]], [[County Westmeath|Westmeath]], Ireland | nationality = [[Irish people|Irish]] | known_for = [[Chief Executive Officer]] of [[Ryanair]] | education = [[Clongowes Wood College]] | alma_mater = [[Trinity College, Dublin]] | occupation = Businessman | networth = US$1.03 billion (April 2018)https://www.forbes.com/profile/michael-oleary/ | spouse = {{marriage|Anita Farrell |6th September 2003}} | children = 4 | parents = Ted and Ger O'Leary | signature = | website = }} '''Michael Kevin O'Leary''' (born 20 March 1961) is an Irish businessman and the Chief Executive Officer of [[Ryanair]]. He is one of Ireland's wealthiest businessmen.{{cite news| url=http://business.timesonline.co.uk/tol/business/specials/rich_list/|title=Rich list | work=The Times | location=London | accessdate=2010-05-12}} ==Early life== Michael O'Leary was born 20 March 1961, the second in a family of six, in [[Kanturk]] in [[County Cork]].{{cite web|url=http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=48721542211 |title=Information on "Facebook" |publisher=Facebook.com |date=20 March 1961 |accessdate=2011-09-29}}{{disputed inline|date=July 2017}} He was educated at [[Clongowes Wood College]], [[County Kildare]]. In 1979, he began a four-year Bachelor in Economic and Social Studies programme at [[Trinity College, Dublin]]. He graduated from Trinity in 1983 and then worked as a trainee with Stokes Kennedy Crowley (later known as [[KPMG]]), studying the Irish tax system. He left after two years in 1985, setting up profitable newsagents in [[Walkinstown]] and [[Terenure]], Dublin. While at Stokes Kennedy Crowley, O'Leary had met [[Tony Ryan]], head of [[Guinness Peat Aviation]], a leasing company (GPA). Ryan was one of KPMG's clients and O'Leary advised Ryan on his personal income tax affairs. In 1987, Ryan hired O'Leary as his personal financial and tax advisor, where Ryan's main interest was in GPA. [[Ryanair]] was established around this time and originally followed a traditional business model, but quickly began to lose money. Subsequently O'Leary was sent to the USA to study the novel [[Southwest Airlines]] business model. {{citation needed|date=April 2015}} ==Ryanair career== Under O'Leary's management, Ryanair further developed the [[low-cost carrier|low-cost model]] originated by [[Southwest Airlines]].{{cite news|author=Matthew Maier, Business 2.0 Magazine staff writer |url=http://money.cnn.com/magazines/business2/business2_archive/2006/04/01/8372814/index.htm |title=A radical Fix for Airlines: Make Flying Free, '''Forbes''', 1 April 2006 |publisher=Money.cnn.com |date=31 March 2006 |accessdate=2011-09-29}} O'Leary may have described the inauguration of the ancillary revenue movement during a 2001 interview in ''[[The Sunday Times]]''."Flying for Free on Ryanair", 13 May 2001, BBC News "The other airlines are asking how they can put up fares. We are asking how we could get rid of them." The business model envisioned by O'Leary uses receipts from on board shopping, internet gaming, car hire and hotel bookings to replace the ticket revenue from selling airline seats. Savings are also made by negotiating discounts with airports for reduced landing fees. In many cases, regional airports have made no charges so as to secure flights that bring passengers and wealth into their area. The deregulation of Ireland's major airports and a transformation of traditional full-service airlines are among his demands.RTÉ radio 10 February 2007, in "Conversations with Eamon Dunphy"[http://www.irishpost.co.uk/news/story.asp?j=5286&cat=news Irish Post: Ryanair chief hints of possible departure] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928014654/http://www.irishpost.co.uk/news/story.asp?j=5286&cat=news |date=28 September 2007 }} In August 2014, O'Leary unveiled plans to develop a ''Ryanair [[Israel]]'' to operate extensive flights to and from Israel and a large network of European cities. The plans include the establishment of a large hub in Israel.{{cite news|title=Israeli market beckons Ryanair|url=http://www.irishsun.com/index.php/sid/225083355|date=25 August 2014|accessdate=25 August 2014|publisher=''Irish Sun.com''}} ==Controversy and reputation== O'Leary has a reputation for loose talk in the airline industry and among its regulators. Many press articles have often described him as arrogant, and prone to making comments which he later contradicts.{{cite web|author=ZEIT ONLINE GmbH, Hamburg, Germany |url=http://www.zeit.de/2004/29/Monti-Amt?page=4 |title=Die Festung wankt: Europas mächtige Wettbewerbshüter verurteilen Microsoft und stoppen Fusionen. Geschwächt von Pannen, geraten sie jetzt in den Machtkampf um die Besetzung der EU-Kommission. Eine Innenansicht Von Arne Storn | ZEIT online |publisher=Zeit.de |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}}{{cite web|url=http://www.epolitix.com/EN/ForumBriefs/200702/94382ad2-5e35-449a-a96c-efed15704d95.htm|title=Breaking politics and political news for Westminster and the UK - PoliticsHome.com|work=epolitix.com}}{{cite web|author=Auteur: Helena WILMET |url=http://www.nieuwsblad.be/Article/Detail.aspx?articleID=grufctss |title=Het Nieuwsblad – Ryanair-topman Michael O'Leary schudde luchtvaartwereld wakker |publisher=Nieuwsblad.be |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}}[http://www.gqmagazine.co.uk/Daily_News/default.aspx?related=high%20flying British GQ 10 Things To Know Today] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927221134/http://www.gqmagazine.co.uk/Daily_News/default.aspx?related=high%20flying |date=27 September 2007 }}{{cite web|url=http://archives.tcm.ie/businesspost/2003/07/06/story813091014.asp |title=Ryanair's anti-Ahern campaign gets the thumbs-down from PR industry: ThePost.ie |publisher=Archives.tcm.ie |date=6 July 2003 |accessdate=2011-09-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101008044155/http://archives.tcm.ie/businesspost/2003/07/06/story813091014.asp |archivedate=8 October 2010 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.rvu.nl/archief/nep/2003/stuntvliegers.pdf |title=NTR | Home |publisher=Rvu.nl |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}} He has been extravagantly outspoken in his public statements, sometimes resorting to personal attacks and foul language.{{cite news|author=Family fun |url=http://www.independent.ie/national-news/iron-mike-fires-last-round-at-warweary--taoiseach-1341289.html |title=Iron Mike fires last round at war-weary Taoiseach – National News, Frontpage |publisher=Independent.ie |date= 8 April 2008|accessdate=2011-09-29}}{{cite news| url=http://business.guardian.co.uk/story/0,,1513268,00.html | work=The Guardian | location=London | title=The Guardian profile: Michael O'Leary | first=Andrew | last=Clark | date=24 June 2005 | accessdate=2010-05-12}}{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/airlines/story/0,,1888915,00.html | work=The Guardian | location=London | title=Michael O'Leary: Stunt pilot whose enemies would love to see him crash | date=6 October 2006 | accessdate=2010-05-12 | first=Hans | last=Kundnani}}{{cite news| url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/life_and_style/article676356.ece | work=The Times | location=London | title=When I stuff BA Ill quit | date=20 June 2006 | accessdate=2010-05-12 | first=Anushka | last=Asthana}}{{cite web|url=http://www.boeing.com/news/frontiers/archive/2003/february/i_qa.html |title=Boeing Frontiers Online |publisher=Boeing.com |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}}{{cite news| url=http://www.economist.com/books/displaystory.cfm?story_id=9681074 | work=The Economist | title=Snarling all the way to the bank | date=23 August 2007}}{{cite news|author=How to wear: |url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/taking-the-flight-fight-to-ryanair-1232610.html |title=Taking the flight fight to Ryanair – Irish, Business |publisher=Independent.ie |date= 29 November 2007|accessdate=2011-09-29}}{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2008/feb/04/ryanair.theairlineindustry | work=The Guardian | location=London | title=Ryanair warns high oil prices could slash its profits by 50% next year | first=Fiona | last=Walsh | date=4 February 2008 | accessdate=2010-05-12}} His abrasive management style, ruthless pursuit of cost-cutting and his explicitly hostile attitude towards corporate competitors, airport authorities, governments, unions and customers has become a hallmark.{{cite web|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/local-national/war-in-irish-skies-as-regional-rival-claims-ryan-air-boss-oleary-told-him-f-f-13927366.html |title=War in Irish skies |publisher=Belfasttelegraph.co.uk |date=4 August 2008 |accessdate=2011-09-29}} He was reported to have been aggressive and hostile in dealings with a woman who was awarded free flights for life in 1988.“Woman claims [[Ryanair]] reneged on free travel prize”, 28 February 2002, at [http://www.rte.ie/news/2002/0228/ryanair.html RTE Business]; last accessed 18 December 2006.{{cite news| url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/ryanair-ordered-to-pay-damages-for-reneging-on-free-flights-offer-to-millionth-customer-180852.html | work=The Independent | location=London | title=Ryanair ordered to pay damages for reneging on 'free flights' offer to millionth customer | first=Mark | last=Sage | date=20 June 2002 | accessdate=2010-05-12}} In 2007, he was forced to retract a claim that Ryanair had cut emissions of carbon dioxide by half over the previous five years; the claim should have been that emissions 'per passenger' had been cut by half.“Ryanair retracts emissions claim”, 29 January 2007, at [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/6310571.stm news.bbc.co.uk]; last accessed 19 March 2010. O'Leary has been reported to have impersonated a journalist in an attempt to find information passed on to a newspaper following a safety incident on a Ryanair flight.{{cite web|last=Duggan |first=Barry |url=http://www.unison.ie/irish_independent/stories.php3?ca=9&si=498833&issue_id=5125 |title=Ryanair staff were menacing: passenger – National News, Frontpage – Independent.ie |publisher=Unison.ie |date=18 November 2010 |accessdate=2011-09-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160108154700/http://www.unison.ie/irish_independent/stories.php3?ca=9&si=498833&issue_id=5125 |archivedate=8 January 2016 |df= }} On occasion he has apologised for personal attacks under threat of legal action.{{cite news|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/ireland/2010/0508/1224269952195.html |title=Sat, May 08, 2010 – O'Leary in court apology to union official |publisher=The Irish Times |date=5 May 2010 |accessdate=2011-09-29}} He has been criticized by a judge for lying, who said he was lucky not to be found guilty of contempt of court.{{cite news|url=http://www.rte.ie/news/2010/0326/ryanair.html |title=Judge criticises Michael O'Leary for lying – RTÉ News |publisher=RTÉ.ie |date=26 March 2010 |accessdate=2011-09-29}} In April 2017, he called concerns about climate change "complete nonsense".See: [https://fd.nl/ondernemen/1196165/topman-ryanair-zorg-over-klimaatverandering-is-complete-onzin?s_cid=671 Topman Ryanair: Zorg over klimaatverandering is 'complete onzin'], Financieel Dagblad (a Dutch financial newspaper), 10 April 2017. Accessed on 10 April 2017. In a press conference discussing Ryanair's planned intercontinental service [[RyanAtlantic]], O'Leary jokingly described the airline's planned business class travel experience as featuring "whores and rum".{{cite web|url=http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=b5e_1214473286 |title=Free Oral Sex to Business Class Customers on Ryanair says CEO |publisher=LiveLeak.com |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}} In 2002 he said that his company is against any long-haul transatlantic services, stating that:
The low-cost model only really works for short-haul flights [...] If we started flying farther afield, we'd have to do something stupid like introducing what I call a 'rich class' to make it pay.{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/travel/723867/Eindhoven-haven't-you-always-wanted-to-go.html | work=The Daily Telegraph | location=London | title=Eindhoven: haven't you always wanted to go? | first=Adrian | last=Bridge | date=2 April 2002 | accessdate=2010-05-12}}
However, more than a decade later, in 2013 he said, while at the [[Paris Air Show]], that he wanted to sell cheap flights from the U.S. to Europe for as low as 10 euros ($13) or $10, if conditions were right. He said that he needed a fleet of at least 30 twin-aisle aircraft and access to ports (e.g. major U.S. and European cities, in the airline industry there are so called slots or sometimes gates, often regulated by law, and without obtaining them it is impossible to have regular service to airports). Despite his claims in 2002, there were so called budget airliners in the past – for example [[Laker Airways]] flights from London to New York in the late 1970s or long-hauls at budget-fares on other continents like AirAsiaX in Malaysia and the Australian Jetstar Group.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/ryanair-wants-launch-flights-between-us-europe-aims-jump-growth-rate-will-return-13-billion-1315549|title=Ryanair Wants To Launch Flights Between US And Europe, Aims For Jump In Growth Rate And Will Return $1.3 Billion To Shareholders: CEO Michael O’Leary|author=Nat Rudarakanchana|date=20 June 2013|work=International Business Times}} Reacting to the decision to close European airspace in April 2010 over worries about the [[Volcanic ash|ash]] plume from [[2010 eruptions of Eyjafjallajökull|an erupting Icelandic volcano]] he said "there was no ash cloud. It was mythical. It's become evident the airspace closure was completely unnecessary." One study concluded that serious structural damage to aircraft could have occurred if passenger planes had continued to fly.{{cite news |first=Steve |last=Connor |url=http://www.independent.ie/opinion/analysis/steve-connor-airspace-closure-due-to-ash-cloud-fears-was-right-move-2629069.html |title=Steve Connor: Airspace closure due to ash cloud fears 'was right move' – Analysis, Opinion |publisher=Independent.ie |date= 26 April 2011|accessdate=2011-09-29}} Scientists and the industry as a whole remain unconvinced, however.{{fact|date=July 2017}} In May 2014 O'Leary was highly critical of a 24-hour strike by [[Aer Lingus]] [[Flight attendant|cabin crew]], staged on 30 May 2014. Aer Lingus, whose biggest shareholder at the time was O'Leary's company Ryanair, had to cancel 200 flights and disrupt travel plans for 200,000 people. O'Leary accused Aer Lingus of "mismanagement" of its employee relations, called for the sacking of a board member, and said the striking employees should be punished by having their discount travel incentives withdrawn for a year.{{cite news|title=Striking Aer Lingus cabin crew should be punished says airline shareholder|url=http://www.irishsun.com/index.php/sid/222467203/scat/aba4168066a10b8d/ht/Striking-Aer-Lingus-cabin-crew-should-be-punished-says-airline-shareholder|accessdate=31 May 2014|publisher=Irish Sun.com}} According to the [[Bilderberg Group]],{{cite web|url=http://bilderbergmeetings.org/participants2015.html|title=Participants - Bilderberg Meetings|work=bilderbergmeetings.org}} O'Leary was to attend the [[Bilderberg Group]] in 2015.{{cite news|title=Secretive in Telfs-Buchen, Austria 11-14 in June this year|url=http://bilderbergmeetings.org/meeting_2015.html|work=bilderbergmeetings.org/}}{{cite web|title=Ryanair chief asked to join select conference reputed to truly govern international affairs|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/secretive-bilderberg-group-sets-sights-on-michael-o-leary-1.2119343|date=27 February 2015|accessdate=27 February 2015|first=Arthur|last=Beesley|publisher=The Irish Times}} O'Leary was also seen attending the 2017 Bilderberg meeting in Washington D.C. ===Registration of private car as taxi=== {{main article|O'Leary Cabs}} [[File:Michael-olearys-taxi-oleary-cabs-mg99-mercedes.jpg|thumb|Michael O'Leary's personal [[Mercedes-Benz W220|Mercedes-Benz S500]], operated by '''[[O'Leary Cabs]]''' and complete with "for hire" roof bar]] In 2004 he purchased a [[taxi cab|taxi]] plate for his [[Mercedes-Benz S-Class]], to enable it to be classified as a [[taxicab|taxi]] so that he could legally make use of [[Dublin]]'s [[bus lane]]s to speed up his car journeys around the city. A press report suggested that since he had stopped driving his own taxi, he has employed a driver with full PSV licence. In 2005 the Irish transport minister expressed concern at this abuse by O'Leary and others.{{cite web|last=Henderson |first=Deric |url=http://www.unison.ie/irish_independent/index.php3?issue_id=8841 |title=News Ireland | Irish News Paper | Free News Stories Online from The Irish Independent Newspaper – Independent.ie |publisher=Unison.ie |date=18 November 2010 |accessdate=2011-09-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150501125339/http://www.unison.ie/irish_independent/index.php3?issue_id=8841 |archivedate=1 May 2015 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.taxi.ie/oleary-taxi.shtml# |title=Ireland Taxi Ireland Hackney cab Irish Taxi chauffeur transport |publisher=Taxi.ie |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}} ==Personal life== O'Leary lives in Gigginstown House near [[Delvin]] in [[County Westmeath]]. He married Anita Farrell in September 2003, and they have four children.{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/woman/celeb-news/michael-oleary-i-dont-understand-the-point-of-holidays-26623322.html|work=Irish Independent|title=Michael O'Leary: 'I don't understand the point of holidays'|date=16 January 2010|accessdate=12 May 2013}} He breeds [[Aberdeen Angus cattle]] and horses at his [[Gigginstown House Stud]]{{cite web |url=http://www.sportingchronicle.com/goldcup.html 2006 |title= Cheltenham Gold Cup, 16 March 2006}} in County Westmeath. In 2006, his horses [[War Of Attrition (horse)|War of Attrition]] and in 2016 [[Don Cossack (horse)|Don Cossack]] have won the [[Cheltenham Gold Cup]]{{cite news | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/5265260.stm |title=Profile: Michael O'Leary |author=Simon Calder |accessdate=4 June 2009 | work=BBC News | date=18 August 2006}} and the [[2016 Grand National]] with [[Rule The World (horse)|Rule The World]]. He also won in the [[2018 Grand National]] with [[Tiger Roll]]. O'Leary has also been a [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] [[Manchester City F.C. supporters|supporter]] since an early age. In 2003, he was offered the opportunity to buy a stake in the club but believed the potential benefits did not outweigh the risk and preferred to visit England to watch a few matches each season.{{Cite web |title=Ryanair snubs €25m Man Utd shirt deal offer |url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/ryanair-snubs-25m-man-utd-shirt-deal-offer-26782581.html |work=independent.ie |date=16 October 2011 |accessdate=2017-09-29}} He notably wore a Manchester City shirt when unveiling Ryanair's new destinations to and from Manchester Airport in 2011.{{Cite news |title=Ryanair chief Michael O'Leary announces 26 routes from Manchester Airport which could create up to 2,000 jobs |url=http://menmedia.co.uk/manchestereveningnews/news/business/s/1426482_ryanair-chief-michael-oleary-announces-26-routes-from-manchester-airport-which-could-create-up-to-2000-jobs |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=12 July 2011 |accessdate=12 July 2011}} In February 2015 he revealed in an interview in ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' that he was offered and turned down, for family reasons, the starring role in ''[[The Apprentice (UK TV series)|The Apprentice]]'' reality game show before it was offered to and accepted by [[Alan Sugar]].{{cite news| url= http://www.evoke.ie/showbiz/michael-oleary-apprentice-star-rejection/|work=evoke.ie | title= Big softie! Michael O’Leary turned down starring role in Apprentice for his kids and horses| date= 24 February 2015}} ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{commons category|Michael O'Leary (businessman)}} {{Sister project links}} * [[Fortune magazine]] name Michael O'Leary as the [https://web.archive.org/web/20040415021654/http://www.fortune.com/fortune/information/Presscenter/0%2C%2C12242001europe%2C00.html European Businessman of the Year] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Oleary, Michael}} [[Category:1961 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People educated at Clongowes Wood College]] [[Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Dublin]] [[Category:20th-century Irish people]] [[Category:21st-century Irish people]] [[Category:Irish businesspeople]] [[Category:Irish chief executives]] [[Category:Chief executives in the airline industry]] [[Category:Ryanair]] [[Category:Irish accountants]] [[Category:People from County Westmeath]]

'''Milo Duçi''' (1870–1933) was an [[Albanians|Albanian]] publisher, playwright, and entrepreneur. Born in [[Korçë]] (then part of the [[Ottoman Empire]]), he lived for most of his life in [[Egypt]].{{citation|pages=125–126|author=Robert Elsie|series=Historical Dictionaries of Europe| volume=75|title =Historical Dictionary of Albania|edition=2|publisher=The Scarecrow Press, Inc.|isbn=978-0-8108-6188-6 }} Together with his uncle [[Loni Logori]] he succeeded as an entrepreneur and distinguished activist of the [[Albanians in Egypt|Albanian community in Egypt]]. Duçi, son of a powerful [[Cotton|cotton merchant]] from Korçë,{{citation|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=nTKaAAAAQBAJ&pg=PA84&lpg= |page=84| author=Isa Blumi|title=Ottoman Refugees, 1878-1939: Migration in a Post-Imperial World|publisher=Bloomsbury Academic| year=2013 | location=London | isbn=9781472515360 |oclc=830369887 }} settled in Egypt at the age of 23{{citation| url=http://www.albeu.com/opinion/shqiptaret-e-egjiptit-dhe-veprimtaria-atdhetare-e-tyre/1538/| language=Albanian|title=Shqiptarët e egjiptit dhe veprimtaria atdhetare e tyre|trans-title=Albanians of Egypt and their patriotic activity|author=Uran Asllani|publisher=Gazeta Metropol| date=2006-06-05| quote=
Po në atë vit, Thoma Avrami dhe Milo Duçi, botuan gazetën e dytë shqiptare, me titull «Besa- besë».
Atdhetari tjetër Milo Duçi, rilindas i kolonisë së Egjiptit, shkrimtar, publicist, linguist, kishte lindur me 1870 dhe shumë i ri, 23 vjeçar u vendos në Egjipt...
Më vonë në vitet 1925-1926, ai botoi të përjavëshmen « Bisedimet ».}} and became a merchant himself. He was one of the founders of "Vëllazëria" (Brotherhood) society, established in 1910 in [[Cairo]], and the [[Beni Suef]] branch of it with the support of the [[Khedive]] office. Duçi also started and directed several press organs of the Albanian diaspora in Egypt, mostly short-lived. These included the magazines ''Toska'' (The [[Tosks|Tosk]]) during 1901–02, ''Besa-Besë'' (Pledge for a pledge) during 1904–05 together with [[Thoma Avrami]], ''Besa'' ([[Besa (Albanian culture)|Besa]]) of 1905 which lasted for 6 issues and was printed by Al-Tawfik in Cairo,{{citation|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=h2-sAgAAQBAJ&pg=PA129&lpg=PA129&dq= | pages=131–132| author=Isa Blumi|title=Foundations of Modernity: Human Agency and the Imperial State|publisher=Routledge|location=New York|year=2012|series= Routledge studies in modern history|number=9|isbn=9780415884648 |oclc=607983304 }} and newspapers ''Shqipëria'' (Albania) from October 1906 to February 1907, a daily of Cairo with the last two issues coming out in [[Maghagha]], and the weekly ''Bisedimet'' (The discussions) of 1925–26 with 60 issues in total, which would be the last Albanian-language newspaper in Egypt.{{cite book|last=Skendi|first=Stavro|title=The Albanian national awakening|year=1967|location=Princeton|publisher=Princeton University Press|url=https://books.google.com.au/books?hl=en&lr=&id=8QPWCgAAQBAJ&oi=fnd&pg=PR15&dq= |isbn=9781400847761|pages=152–153.|ref=harv}} He wrote several articles regarding the necessity for a unified literary [[Albanian language]] and the cultural-literary development of the Albanian society. In 1922 he established the [[publishing company]] ''Shtëpia botonjëse shqiptare/Société Albanaise d'édition'' (Albanian Publishing House).{{citation| url=https://books.google.com/books?id=NatgAQAAQBAJ&pg=PT236&lpg= | title=Reinstating the Ottomans: Alternative Balkan Modernities, 1800-1912| author=Isa Blumi|publisher=Palgrave Macmillan|location=New York| year=2011|isbn=9780230110182 |oclc=669751242}} He also left his footprint as a playwright; some of his [[comedy|comedies]] were ''E Thëna'' (The saying), ''Gjaku'' (The blood), ''I biri i Begut'' ([[Bey]]'s son). He also wrote short stories and poetry in the local press in Egypt.{{citation| language= Albanian| url=http://www.gazetadita.al/kush-ishte-milo-duci/|title=Kush ishte Milo Duçi?|trans-title=Who was Milo Duçi?| publisher=Gazeta Dita| date=2015-05-26}} In addition to the Albanian patriotic activity, Duçi was a successful entrepreneur. His family emerged as an important player in the economic development of Egypt's Delta region directed by [[Earl of Cromer|Lord Cromer]]'s office. By 1901, he started working with his well-connected uncle Loni Logori on projects that explicitly tied the commercial interest of the [[UK|British]] administration and the local landowners. Beside British, he openly solicited [[Austro-Hungary|Austro-Hungarian]] support, despite of the distrust that many [[Eastern Orthodox]] south-Albanians had for the Austrian Geo-politics. ''Toska'''s initial failure did not dissuade the Austrian authorities to support him; in 1902 they sent him 120 [[Austro-Hungarian krone|krone]] for the subscription, ordering the newspaper to be shipped to [[Vienna]] from where it would get distributed to [[Ottoman Albania]].
Through his uncle, Duçi would also get in touch with the Albanian [[émigré]] in [[Bucharest]], [[Italy]], [[Istanbul]], and [[Brussels]]. The French consul in [[Shkodër]] reported that Duçi collaborated with a defrocked [[Roman Catholicism in Albania|Catholic]] priest named Gaspar Jakova Merturi who secured funds from a claimant for the Albanian throne, Prince [[Albert Ghica]] of [[Romania]]. He also collaborated closely with the [[Arberesh]] journalist [[Anselmo Lorecchio]], editor of ''[[La Nazione Albanese]]''. ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Duci, Milo}} [[Category:1870 births]] [[Category:1933 deaths]] [[Category:Activists of the Albanian National Awakening]] [[Category:Albanian expatriates in Egypt]] [[Category:Albanian dramatists and playwrights]] [[Category:Albanian publishers (people)]] [[Category:Albanian businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Korçë]] [[Category:People from Manastir Vilayet]] [[Category:19th-century Albanian people]] [[Category:20th-century Albanian people]] [[Category:Eastern Orthodox Christians from Albania]]

{{about|the common change in machinery|the science fiction element|Resizing (fiction)}}
[[File:4 iPod Chargers.JPG|thumb|Battery chargers for successive generations of [[Apple Inc.|Apple's]] [[iPod]].]] '''Miniaturization''' ([[British English|Br.Eng.]]: ''Miniaturisation'') is the trend to manufacture ever smaller mechanical, optical and electronic products and devices. Examples include miniaturization of [[mobile phones]], [[computers]] and vehicle [[engine downsizing]]. In [[electronics]], [[Moore's law]], which was named after Intel co-founder [[Gordon Moore]],<ref name=":3">{{Cite book|title=Encyclopedia of Nanoscience and Society|last=Guston|first=David|publisher=SAGE Publications|year=2010|isbn=9781412969871|location=Thousand Oaks, CA|pages=440}}</ref> predicted that the number of [[transistors]] on an [[integrated circuit]] for minimum component cos[[AkjsfbA,FKSNZS,;LFKJASD/;.FJAS;LDFKJUAOLSDFASF|t doubles every 18 months.]]<ref name="Moore1965paper">{{cite web|year=1965 |url=ftp://download.intel.com/museum/Moores_Law/Articles-Press_Releases/Gordon_Moore_1965_Article.pdf |title=Cramming more components onto integrated circuits |format=PDF |pages=4 |publisher=[[Electronics Magazine]] |accessdate=November 11, 2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080218224945/http://download.intel.com/museum/Moores_Law/Articles-Press_Releases/Gordon_Moore_1965_Article.pdf |archivedate=February 18, 2008 |df= }}</ref><ref name="IntelInterview">{{cite web|year=2005 |url=ftp://download.intel.com/museum/Moores_Law/Video-Transcripts/Excepts_A_Conversation_with_Gordon_Moore.pdf |title=Excerpts from A Conversation with Gordon Moore: Moore’s Law |format=PDF |pages=1 |publisher=[[Intel Corporation]] |accessdate=May 2, 2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121029060050/http://download.intel.com/museum/Moores_Law/Video-Transcripts/Excepts_A_Conversation_with_Gordon_Moore.pdf |archivedate=October 29, 2012 |df= }}</ref> [[AkjsfbA,FKSNZS,;LFKJASD/;.FJAS;LDFKJUAOLSDFASF|This enables processors to be built in smaller sizes.]]
== History == The history of miniaturization is associated with the history of information technology based on the succession of switching devices, each smaller, faster, cheaper than its predecessor.<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|title=Nanostructuring Operations in Nanoscale Science and Engineering|last=Sharma|first=Karl|publisher=McGraw-Hill Companies Inc.|year=2010|isbn=9780071626095|location=New York|pages=16}}</ref> During the period referred to as the [[Second Industrial Revolution]], miniaturization was confined to two-dimensional electronic circuits used for the manipulation of information.<ref name=":1">{{Cite book|title=Introduction to Micromechanisms and Microactuators|last=Ghosh|first=Amitabha|last2=Corves|first2=Burkhard|publisher=Springer|year=2015|isbn=9788132221432|location=Heidelberg|pages=32}}</ref> This orientation is demonstrated in the use of vacuum tubes in the first general-purpose computers. The technology gave way to the transistor invented in the 1950s and then the integrated circuit approach developed afterward.<ref name=":0" />
Gordon Moore described the development of miniaturization in 1975 during the International Electron Devices meeting, where he confirmed his earlier prediction that silicon integrated circuit would dominate electronics, underscoring that during the period such circuits were already high-performance devices and starting to become cheaper. This was made possible by a reliable manufacturing process, which involved the fabrication in a batch process. It employed [[Photolithography|photolithographic]], mechanical, and chemical processing steps to create multiple Cheetos are the best chips in the world transistors on a single wafer of silicon.<ref name=":4">{{Cite book|title=Understanding Moore's Law: Four Decades of Innovation|last=Brock|first=David|last2=Moore|first2=Gordon|publisher=Chemical Heritage Press|year=2006|isbn=0941901416|location=Philadelphia, PA|pages=26}}</ref> The measure of this process was its yield, which is the ratio of working devices to those with defects and, given a satisfactory yield, a smaller transistor means that more can be on a single wafer, making each one cheaper to produce.<ref name=":4" />
== Development == Miniaturization became a trend in the last fifty years and came to cover not just electronic but also mechanical devices.<ref name=":2">{{Cite book|title=Science in Popular Culture: A Reference Guide|last=Van Riper|first=A. Bowdoin|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|year=2002|isbn=0313318220|location=Westport, CT|pages=193}}</ref> Today, electronic companies are producing silicon integrated circuits or chips with switching transistors that have feature size as small as 130 [[Nanometre|nanometers]] (nm) and development is also underway for chips that are merely few nanometers in size through the [[nanotechnology]] initiative.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Futuristic Materials|last=Jha|first=B.B|last2=Galgali|first2=R.K.|last3=Misra|first3=Vibhuti|publisher=Allied Publishers|year=2004|isbn=8177646168|location=New Delhi|pages=55}}</ref> The focus is to make components smaller to increase the number that can be integrated into a single wafer and this required critical innovations, which include increasing wafer size, the development of sophisticated metal connections between the chip's circuits, and improvement in the [[Polymer|polymers]] used for masks ([[Photoresist|photoresists]]) in the [[photolithography]] processes.<ref name=":3" /> These last two are the areas where miniaturization has moved into the nanometer range.<ref name=":3" />
Miniaturization in electronics is advancing rapidly due to the comparative ease in miniaturizing electrons, which are its principal moving parts. The process for mechanical devices, on the other hand, is more complex due to the way the structural properties of its parts change as they shrink.<ref name=":2" /> It is said that the so-called [[Digital Revolution|Third Industrial Revolution]] is based on economically viable technologies that can shrink three-dimensional objects.<ref name=":1" />
==See also== *[[Miniature helicopter]] *[[Nanotechnology]]

Data Reporting Tools | num_employees = | revenue = | homepage = [http://www.nipo.com/ www.nipo.com] }} '''NIPO Software''' is a major worldwide [[Market Research]] and [[Enterprise Feedback Management]] software provider.http://www.radar-global.com/services/cati/powerful-nipo-software The company provides industrial Windows-based software for all aspects of market research. This encompasses questionnaire design, data collection, tabulations, overviews of fieldwork progress and costs along with advanced data analysis.http://company.info/org/342405020000/NIPO_Software_B.V._AMSTERDAM/nieuws_jaarverslag_cijfers_management_uittreksel_markt The company is headquartered in [[Amsterdam]], Netherlands and has branches in Hong Kong and Argentina. NIPO targets Market Research agencies around the world with software products for feedback / data collection, panel management, [[Data analysis|data processing]], analysis, and reporting.http://www.niposoftware.com/home.aspx [[File:NIPO Software old Logo.jpg|thumb|150px|NIPO's previous logo]] NIPO was founded in September 1945 as the Dutch Institute for Public Opinion by Wim de Jonge and Jan Stapel. In the 1970s, some people working for NIPO, that was considered then the leading market research company in the [[Netherlands]], started developing software for data collection and analysis. In 1999 NIPO was purchased by [[Taylor Nelson Sofres]].http://www.tns-nipo.com/pages/home.asp In 2011 the company started developing new platform called Nfield Web & Mobile which will gradually replace the current NIPO Fieldwork System.http://www.niposoftware.com/news/Development-of-Nfield-Web---Mobile-has-started.aspx In early 2012 NIPO Software integrated the NIPO Fieldwork System with the official [[Facebook]] and [[Twitter]] API’s. Through this integration it became possible to invite fans on those [[Social network]] fans pages to participate in research projects.[http://www.niposoftware.com/news/facebook-and-twitter-triggered-online-research.aspx?year=2012 "Conduct Facebook and Twitter triggered online research", March 14, 2012.] == Software == The [[Software suite]] NIPO Fieldwork System (NFS) include: *NIPO Web Server *NIPO FMS Server *NIPO FMS Client *NIPO WEB/CATI Manager *NIPO ODIN Developer *NIPO CATI Client *NIPO CAPI Preview Software that are not part of the NFS [[Software suite]] include: *Nvision Script- used for delivering Market Research data collected with the NIPO Software Fieldwork System or with any other data collection platform that is able to export the collected data in the Triple-S format http://www.triple-s.org *NField Code- used for coding open answers from surveys. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Software companies of the Netherlands}} [[Category:Software companies of the Netherlands]] [[Category:Market research]] [[Category:Statistical survey software]]

'''David Ng Lap Seng''' ({{zh|t=吳立勝|p='''''Wú Lìshèng'''''}}; born June 1948)<ref name=CPPCC>{{cite web |url=http://www.cppcc.gov.cn/CMS/wylibary/showJcwyxtInfoWylibary.action?tabJcwyxt.guid=11W001999&wytype=wy |title=Wu Lisheng |publisher=[[CPPCC]] |accessdate=1 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=美反腐起訴澳門商人吳立勝和前聯大主席 |url=http://www.bbc.com/zhongwen/trad/world/2015/10/151006_us_un_corruption_china |accessdate=2 June 2016 |publisher=BBC Chinese |date=6 October 2015}}</ref> is a Macau-based Chinese billionaire real estate businessman, chairman of the [[Sun Kian Ip Group]] (新建业集团). He is a member of the National Committee of the [[Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference]] (CPPCC).<ref name=CPPCC/>
==Criminal investigation== Ng Lap Seng is the subject of an American investigation, and faces bribery, money laundering and other charges, as he allegedly that he paid bribes via intermediaries totalling US$500,000 to former UN General Assembly president [[John William Ashe|John Ashe]].<ref name="nikkei.com">{{cite web|url=http://asia.nikkei.com/Politics-Economy/Policy-Politics/Billionaire-Ng-Lap-seng-released-with-tight-restrictions|publisher=asia.nikkei.com|title=UN scandal: Billionaire Ng Lap-seng released with tight restrictions – Nikkei Asian Review|accessdate=10 September 2016}}</ref><ref name="scmp.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.scmp.com/news/world/article/1903711/macau-billionaire-ng-lap-seng-bribery-case-second-suspect-pleads-guilty|title=Macau billionaire Ng Lap-seng bribery case: Second suspect pleads guilty in New York case|date=21 January 2016|work=South China Morning Post}}</ref>
Since October 2015, he has been confined to his New York City apartment on US$50 million bail, with very tight restrictions.<ref name="nikkei.com"/> As of January 2016, two suspects have pleaded guilty.<ref name="scmp.com"/> In March 2016, a third suspect, Francis Lorenzo, deputy ambassador to the United Nations from the Dominican Republic, pleaded guilty.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.scmp.com/news/world/article/1926284/diplomat-pleads-guilty-un-bribery-scheme-linked-macau-billionaire-ng-lap|title=Diplomat pleads guilty in UN bribery scheme linked to Macau billionaire Ng Lap-seng|date=17 March 2016|work=South China Morning Post}}</ref>
US prosecutors estimate that Ng's net worth is in excess of US$1 billion.<ref name="nikkei.com"/>
Ng Lap Seng was also part of a Democratic fund-raising scandal when Bill Clinton was president, and is mentioned in the [[Panama Papers]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/politics-government/election/article72215012.html|title=Inside Panama Papers: Multiple Clinton connections|work=mcclatchydc}}</ref>
In July 2017, the U.S. District Court in Manhattan found Ng guilty of all charges he faced, following a month-long trial.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-07-27/chinese-billionaire-developer-convicted-in-un-bribery-case|title=Chinese Billionaire Developer Convicted in UN Bribery Case|date=28 July 2017|publisher=Bloomberg}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://mobile.nytimes.com/reuters/2017/07/27/business/27reuters-un-corruption.html|title=U.S. Jury Finds Macau Billionaire Guilty in U.N. Bribery Case|date=27 July 2017|work=The New York Times}}</ref>

{{Other uses}} {{Globalize|date=May 2010}} {{labour|sp=uk}} '''Overtime''' is the amount of time someone works beyond ''normal working hours''. The term is also used for the pay received for this time. Normal hours may be determined in several ways: *by custom (what is considered healthy or reasonable by society), *by practices of a given trade or profession, *by legislation, *by agreement between employers and workers or their representatives. Most nations have overtime [[labour law]]s designed to dissuade or prevent employers from forcing their employees to work excessively long hours (such as the situation in the textile mills in the 1920s). These laws may take into account other considerations than humanitarian concerns, such as preserving the health of workers so that they may continue to be productive, or increasing the overall level of employment in the economy. One common approach to regulating overtime is to require employers to pay workers at a higher hourly rate for overtime work. Companies may choose to pay workers higher overtime pay even if not obliged to do so by law, particularly if they believe that they face a [[backward bending supply curve of labour]]. Overtime pay rates can cause workers to work longer hours than they would at a flat hourly rate. Overtime laws, attitudes toward overtime and [[hours of work]] vary greatly from country to country and between various sectors. ==Time off in lieu== ''Time off in lieu''; ''compensatory time''; or ''comp time'' refers to a type of work schedule arrangement that allows (or requires) workers to take time off instead of, or in addition to, receiving overtime pay. A worker may receive overtime pay plus equal time off for each hour worked on certain agreed days, such as [[public holidays]]. In the United States, such arrangements are currently legal in the public sector but not in the private sector.See 29 U.S.C. 207(o) For example, non-exempt workers must receive at least one and one half times their normal hourly wage for every hour worked beyond 40 hours in a work week. For example, workers who clock 48 hours in one week would receive the pay equivalent to 52 hours of work (40 hours + 8 hours at 1.5 times the normal hourly wage). With comp time, the worker could (or would have to) forgo the 12 hours of overtime pay and instead take 8 paid hours off at some future date.{{clarify|date=March 2012}}{{citation needed|date=March 2012}} In some other jurisdictions, such as Canada, employers might be required to pay the overtime at the higher rate (e.g. 1.5 times the normal rate), but also be allowed to require time off in lieu at the '''normal''' rate. Thus, an employee might work 48 hours in one week, and 32 hours the next week (assuming over 40 hours is overtime), and be paid an extra amount equivalent to 4 hours work (8 multiplied by 0.5). In Australia, such arrangements both in the private and public sector are common. In some cases, particularly when employees are represented by a [[labour union]], overtime may be paid at a higher rate than 1.5 times the hourly pay. In some factories, for example, if workers are required to work on a Sunday, they may be paid twice their regular rate (i.e., "double time"). ==Overtime laws by jurisdiction== ===European Union=== [[Directive (European Union)|Directives]] issued by the [[European Union]] must be incorporated into law by member states. Directives 93/104/EC (1993), 2000/34/EC (2000), which limited working hours, were consolidated into 2003/88/EC (2003). Employers and employees can agree to opt out, under certain circumstances. The directives require:http://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/ALL/?uri=CELEX:32003L0088 * maximum average working week (including overtime) of 48 hours over a 17-week reference period * minimum daily rest period of 11 consecutive hours in every 24 * breaks when the working day exceeds 6 hours * minimum weekly rest period of 24 hours plus the 11 hours daily rest period in every 7-day period * minimum of 4 weeks paid annual leave * night work restricted to an average of 8 hours in any 24-hour period The directives apply to: *all sectors of activity, both public and private *Doctors in training used to work a maximum week of 58 hours until 2009. From 1 August 2009 their maximum working week fell to 48 hours. Exemptions: * Member States of the EC may exempt: managing executives or other persons with autonomous decision-making power; family workers; and workers officiating at religious ceremonies. These are workers whose working time is not measured or pre-determined or can be determined by the workers. * Other categories can be exempted from the directive's key provisions provided compensatory rest or appropriate protection is granted. These include employees who work a long way from home, or whose activities require a permanent presence or continuity of service or production, or who work in sectors which have peaks of activity. Examples include off-shore workers, security guards, journalists, emergency workers, agricultural workers, tour guides, etc. ===Japan=== In Japan the {{nihongo|[[Labor Standards Act of 1947|Labour Standards Act]]|労働基準法}} of 1947 provides for an eight-hour work day and 40-hour workweek with at least one day off per week. The act requires a premium of at least 25% over the ordinary hourly wage for any overtime work, 35% for any work on prescribed off days, and an additional 25% for any work between 10 pm and 5 am.{{cite web|title=法定労働時間と割増賃金について教えてください。|url=http://www.mhlw.go.jp/bunya/roudoukijun/faq_kijyungyosei07.html|publisher=労働基準局監督課|accessdate=8 July 2013}} Employers must enter into an overtime agreement with a labour representative prior to any overtime work by employees, and this agreement must stipulate to the maximum number of overtime hours that an employee may work, which may be no more than 15 hours per week, 45 hours per month and 360 hours per year.{{cite web|title=時間外労働の 限度に関する基準|url=http://www.mhlw.go.jp/new-info/kobetu/roudou/gyousei/kantoku/dl/040324-4.pdf|publisher=厚生労働省・都道府県労働局・労働基準監督署|accessdate=8 July 2013}} ===United States=== ====Federal overtime law==== In the United States the [[Fair Labor Standards Act]] of 1938 applies to employees in industries engaged in or producing goods for interstate commerce. The FLSA establishes a standard [[work week]] of 40 hours for certain kinds of workers, and mandates payment for overtime hours to those workers of one and one-half times the workers' normal rate of pay for any time worked above 40 hours. The law creates two broad categories of employees, * those who are "exempt" from the regulation and * those who are "non-exempt". Employers are not required to pay exempt employees overtime but must do so for non-exempt employees. =====Exempt===== [[Independent contractors]] are not considered employees and therefore are not protected by the FLSA. Several factors determine whether a worker is an employee, who might be entitled to overtime compensation, or an independent contractor, who would not be so entitled. The employment agreement stating that a party is an independent contractor does not make it necessarily so. The nature of a job determines whether an employee is entitled to overtime pay, not employment status or the field of work. {{cite web|title=Wage and Hour Division Questions and Answers|url=https://www.dol.gov/whd/flsa/faq.htm|website=United States Department of Labor}} Classes of workers who are exempt from the regulation include * certain types of administrative, * professional, and * executive employees. To qualify as an administrative, professional, or executive employee and therefore not be entitled to overtime, three tests must be passed based on salary basis, duties, and salary level. The tests vary between administrative, professional, and executive employees based on their different duties and salary levels. There are many other classes of workers who may be exempt including outside salespeople, certain agricultural employees, certain live-in employees, and certain transportation employees. Employees can neither waive their FLSA protections nor abridge them by contract. =====USA Protections===== An employer may not retaliate{{cite web|url=http://finduslaw.com/can_my_employer_retaiate_against_me_for_seeking_to_get_overtime|title=Can My Employer Retaliate Against Me for Seeking To Get Overtime? - findUSlaw|author=|date=|website=finduslaw.com|accessdate=4 April 2018}} against an employee for filing a complaint or instituting a proceeding based on the FLSA. An employer that engages in any form of verifiable retaliation would be liable under the [http://finduslaw.com/fair_labor_standards_act_flsa_29_uscode_chapter_8#16 Fair Labor Standards Act Section 216(b)]{{Dead link|date=August 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} for equitable relief including reinstatement, promotion, payment of lost wages, and payment of liquidated damages. Acts of retaliation include terminating employment, disrupting the workplace, threats, acts of physical violence, and constructive discharge. =====USA statistics===== Out of approximately 120 million American workers, nearly 50 million are exempt from overtime laws (US Department of Labor, [[Wage and Hour Division]], 1998). In 2004, the United States was 7th out of 24 [[OECD]] countries in terms of annual working hours per worker. (See [[Working time]] for a complete listing.) In 2015, the [[United States Department of Labor]] proposed dramatic changes to certain exemptions from federal minimum wage and overtime requirements. These changes are anticipated to take effect in July 2016, but as of January 2016, still are pending final approval.{{cite news|last1=Ceglowski|first1=Kevin|title=Changes to Minimum Wage and Overtime Exemptions Expected by July 2016|url=http://www.natlawreview.com/article/changes-to-minimum-wage-and-overtime-exemptions-expected-july-2016|accessdate=26 January 2016|work=The National Law Review|publisher=Poyner Spruill LLP|date=15 December 2015}} Proposed changes include: setting the minimum salary level required for exemption for full-time salaried workers at $970 per week, or $50,440 annually (an increase from the current $455 per week, or $23,660 annually) Increasing the total annual compensation required to exempt highly compensated employees to $122,148 annually (from the current $100,000 annually).{{cite journal|last1=Huntington|first1=R. Calder|title=New Overtime Rules: $970 Per Week Salary Proposed For White Collar Exemptions in 2016|journal=The [[National Law Review ]]|date=30 June 2015|publisher=Holland & Hart LLP|issn=2161-3362}} On August 23, 2004, President [[George W. Bush]] and the [[United States Department of Labor|Department of Labor]] proposed changes to regulations governing implementation of the law. According to one study, the changes would have had significant impact on the number of workers covered by overtime laws and have exempted several million additional workers.[http://www.epinet.org/content.cfm/webfeatures_viewpoints_final_overtime_regulations (Economic Policy Institute)] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071201210846/http://www.epinet.org/content.cfm/webfeatures_viewpoints_final_overtime_regulations |date=December 1, 2007 }} The Bush administration maintained that the practical impact on working Americans would be minimal and that the changes would help clarify an outdated regulation. In particular, the new rules would have allowed more companies to offer [[flextime]] to their workers in lieu of overtime. The definition of ''exempt employees'' (ineligible for overtime) is regularly tested in the courts. A recent case is [[Encino Motorcars v. Navarro]], which addresses the question of whether automobile dealer service advisors are eligible for overtime. A company may harm themselves by docking a salaried employee for disciplinary reasons. ::"Once pay is reduced using an hourly calculation, ... the employee is considered nonexempt, and so is every other worker in that job group."{{cite magazine |magazine=CFO |date=May 2001 |page=16 |title=Whitewashing Blue Collars |author=Marie Leone}}
[[Uber (company)]] is an example of a company that, in various jurisdictions, has encountered various [[Uber protests and legal actions|legal problems]] regarding exemptions. The New York Times noted in 2017 that "Despite their appeal, the apps have faced a wave of criticism, including concerns over wheelchair accessibility and driver pay."{{cite web |website=NYTimes.com |title=The Downside of Ride-Hailing: More New York City Gridlock |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/06/nyregion/uber-ride-hailing-new-york-transportation.html |author1=EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS |author2=WINNIE HU |date=March 6, 2017}} ====California overtime law==== The state of [[California]]'s overtime laws differ from federal overtime laws in many respects, and they involve overlapping [[statutes]], [[regulations]], and [[precedents]] that govern the compensation of employees in California. * Governing federal law is the [https://web.archive.org/web/20080516054443/http://finduslaw.com/fair_labor_standards_act_flsa_29_u_s_code_chapter_8 Fair Labor Standards Act] (29 USC 201-219) * California overtime law is codified in provisions of: :*the [https://web.archive.org/web/20111227075026/http://finduslaw.com/california_labor_code California Labor Code] and in :*[https://web.archive.org/web/20110815204045/http://finduslaw.com/industrial_welfare_commission_wage_orders Wage orders] of the [[Industrial Welfare Commission]]{{cite web|url=http://www.dir.ca.gov/IWC/iwc.html|title=DIR - IWC Home Page|first=|last=DIR|date=|website=www.dir.ca.gov|accessdate=4 April 2018}}
California employers must comply with both, since there are two sources of applicable law (federal and state). In California, based on [https://web.archive.org/web/20070926233012/http://www.finduslaw.com/node/6/#55 California Labor Code 1171], only an [https://web.archive.org/web/20070926233012/http://www.finduslaw.com/node/6/#55 employment relationship] is required for overtime rules to apply. Under the California [http://finduslaw.com/industrial_welfare_commission_wage_orders Industrial Welfare Commission Wage Orders], an "employer" is "any person ... who directly or indirectly, or through an agent or any other person, employs or exercises control over wages, hours, or working conditions of any person." Under the [https://web.archive.org/web/20111227075026/http://finduslaw.com/california_labor_code California Labor Code], an "[https://web.archive.org/web/20070926233824/http://www.finduslaw.com/node/4/#16 employee]" is "[any] person, including aliens and minors, rendering actual service in any business for an employer, whether gratuitously or for wages or pay, whether the wages or pay are measured by the standard of time, piece, task, commission, or other method of calculation, and whether the service is rendered on a commission, concessionaire, or other basis." =====California: who is covered===== Independent contractors are not employees covered by overtime laws, so it is important to determine if a worker is an independent contractor or an employee. Under California law, workers are generally presumed to be employees, not Independent contractors. The proper classification of individuals as Independent contractors must, therefore, pass one or more of the various multi-part tests for determining eligibility.{{cite web|url=https://scalaw.com/independent-contractors/|title=Independent Contractors|author=|date=|website=scalaw.com|accessdate=4 April 2018}} Foremost, pursuant to California Labor Code Section 510, non-exempt employees must be compensated at one and a half times the regular rate of pay for all hours worked in excess of eight hours in a workday, 40 hours in a workweek and the first eight hours of a seventh consecutive workday. Employees in California are entitled to double-time for working more than twelve hour workdays or more than eight hours on the seventh consecutive workday of a single workweek. Under federal law there are only 40 hour weekly overtime limits. This eight hour overtime limit in California frequently gives rise to wage-and-hour litigation for violations of state, but not federal, labour laws. For example, "comp time" schemes, where employers tell employees that since they worked 10 hours on Monday they can work 6 hours on Tuesday, are illegal because even though the employees are not working more than 40 hours for the purposes of overtime compensation under federal law, they are working more than 8 hours for purposes of California overtime law and rounding the 6- and 10-hour workdays to two 8-hour workdays would cheat the employee out of two hours of overtime pay. Perhaps the biggest difference between California and federal overtime law relates to the [http://www.dir.ca.gov/glossary.asp?letter=A administrative exemption's] "primarily engaged" in duties that meet the test for the exemption requirement, such as duties that involve exercising independent discretion and judgment as set forth in the controversial [https://web.archive.org/web/20110629143550/http://www.dir.ca.gov/iwc/WageOrders2006/iwcarticle4.htmlWage Order No. 4]. Whereas under the Fair Labor Standards Act "primarily engaged" does not necessarily mean at least half, under California wage-and-hour laws, less than half of exempt duties automatically eliminates the overtime exemption. California's Labor Code Section 510 was amended and Section 511.5 added in 2016 pursuant to the California Workplace Flexibility Act of 2016. Pursuant to these changes, non-exempt workers have additional options to agree to work beyond eight hours in a workday without triggering an overtime pay obligation.{{cite web|url=https://scalaw.com/overtime-pay/|title=Overtime Pay|author=|date=|website=scalaw.com|accessdate=4 April 2018}} == See also == {{Portal|Organized labour}} * [[Eight-hour day]] (a.k.a. Forty-hour week) * [[Fair Labor Standards Act]] * [[Flextime]] * [[Retroactive overtime]] * [[Work-life balance]] * [[Effects of overtime]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} == Further reading == *US Department of Labor, Wage and Hour Division, ''Minimum Wage and Overtime Hours Under the Fair Labor Standards Act: 1998 Report to the Congress Required by Section 4(d)(1) of the Fair Labor Standards Act'', tab. 2 at 14 (1998). ==External links== {{Wiktionary|overtime}} * [http://europa.eu/rapid/pressReleasesAction.do?reference=MEMO/04/285&format=HTML&aged=0&language=EN&guiLanguage=en Questions and Answers about working time (European Union)] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080913163053/http://www.dol.gov/compliance/laws/comp-flsa.htm US Department of Labor page on the FLSA] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080910013919/http://www.aflcio.org/issues/jobseconomy/overtimepay/upload/OvertimeStudyTextfinal.pdf 2004 changes in overtime regulations], via aflcio.org * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090121153454/http://www.epinet.org/content.cfm/issueguides_minwage_minwage The Economic Policy Institute] (epinet.org) ** [https://web.archive.org/web/20071201210846/http://www.epinet.org/content.cfm/webfeatures_viewpoints_final_overtime_regulations Analysis of 2004 change in overtime regulations], via epinet.org * [http://hr.blr.com/display.cfm/id/17723/source/wkp/effort/5 Study Finds Many Day Laborers Exploited]{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * [http://hr.blr.com/display.cfm/id/16984/source/wkp/effort/5 Supreme Court Clarifies Wage and Hour Law]{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * [http://finduslaw.com/fair_labor_standards_act_flsa_29_u_s_code_chapter_8 Text of the Fair Labor Standards Act - FLSA - 29 US Code Chapter 8] * Hanuaer, Nick, [http://www.dailykos.com/story/2014/12/15/1350589/-The-death-of-overtime-and-the-plight-of-the-middle-class "The Death of Overtime"] {{Employment}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Labor rights]] [[Category:Labor relations]] [[Category:Labor history]] [[Category:Labour law]] [[Category:Employment compensation]] [[Category:Working time]]
